Description: National Healthcare Corporation agreed to pay the United States $27 million to resolve allegations under the False Claims Act that beginning in 1991 the company submitted nursing home cost reports that falsely claimed that facility staff members spent more time caring for Medicare patients than they actually did in order to collect additional money from the federal health care program.

Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Company: NATIONAL HEALTHCARE CORPORATION DBA NHC HEALTHCARE
Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
